intro: Tylophoropsis, commonly known as the "false spurge," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and clustered flowers. They are native to regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia, often growing in tropical and subtropical climates. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Tylophoropsis species are also noted for their ability to thrive in poor soils, making them adaptable to various ecological conditions.
